info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 12:17PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MECKLENBURG AND EASTERN YORK COUNTIES UNTIL 1245 PM EST... At 1217 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall near Rock Hill, moving northeast at 15 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Rock Hill, Southwest Charlotte, Fort Mill, Pineville, Tega Cay, Newport, Steele Creek, Carowinds, Lake Wylie and Lesslie. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
